chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard Santistevan was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 1/15/16 - SHALL RECEIVE 14 DAYS PRESENTENCE CREDIT SHOULD SUPERVISION BE REVOKED
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge within 60 days (3/14/16) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.addlTxt:
15CF321,15TR7052,15TR7053,15TR7054 - Defendant Richard  Santistevan in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  NC charge entered in count 1 of 15CF321.  Court accepts plea and finds def guilty. Count 2 in 15CF321 is dismissed and all other counts are DRI (including TR cases).  State heard on sentencing recomendation.  Atty Moeller responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

w/h sentence - 3 yrs probation
180 days DCJ w/h&t and work release as COP - comm. immed.
$1,200 + cost - bail posted shall be applied to fine
AODA 
maintain absolute sobriety
not go on premises whose primary business involves sale/distribution of alcoholic beverages
not operate motor vehicle w/o valid DL
VIP
36 mos rev & ignition interlocki
DNA sample

Court exempts 2 vehicles from ignition device and grants request to reduce ignition fee on any owned or operated vehciles.
to file leave to file additional motions or to amend or supplement motions

Defendant Richard  Santistevan in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF321 & 15TR7052, 7053 &7054(tracking);  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; all TR cases to track; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

(15CF321, 15TR7052, 7053 & 7054) Defendant Richard Santistevan in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews all TR cases and def stands mute and Court will enter not guilty on def's behalf in all the TR cases; waiver of prelim is reviewed and matter set for arraignment; parties heard on bail modification; Court heard and modifys bond to $2500 cash;  Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:46) Defendant Richard Santistevan in custody via video with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (will appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. State heard on bond, $50,000 Cash; Atty. Moeller response, Def. is not homeless; Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 10/22/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 2; Court sets $10,000 CASH BOND with conditions:  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.
